channel.title: Articles in Citizen Matters categorized under Power
channel.description: These are the published articles in Citizen Matters categorized under Power

item.title: How to save electricity intelligently and smartly
item.dc:creator: Sunil Sood
item.description: Looking to reduce your BESCOM bills? Do it smartly. This guide is for you.

item.title: Dear city leaders: something is rotting in the city of Bengaluru
item.dc:creator: Meera K
Meera Nair
item.description: Potholed roads, miserable traffic, stinking garbage all around, scares of epidemics, lakes spewing toxic foam. What more do we need? Request to all politicians: work with us or go hibernate.

item.title: Power holidays for industries under BESCOM limits: Good or bad?
item.dc:creator: Akshatha M
item.description: Power crisis in the state has forced BESCOM to declare power holidays for industrial areas. While industries lying in industrial areas seem to be functioning well, this seems to be a death stroke for the small and medium industries that operate out of non-industrial, residential areas.

item.title: Here’s how Bengaluru’s electricity crisis can be averted
item.dc:creator: Raman Muthuswamy
item.description: Price hike is not the only solution to recover losses of power-producing agencies in Bengaluru and Karnataka. Why not produce more electricity to meet demand?

item.title: If you want to install rooftop solar power station, this is for you!
item.dc:creator: News Desk
item.description: This workshop will help you identify right system suited to your use. Queries will be answered by the experts. This is a must-go workshop if you want to make best use of solar energy!

item.title: CM avare, Let’s change the game of power distribution in Bangalore!
item.dc:creator: Muralidhar Rao
item.description: Delhi follows a public-private partnership power supply model, with 49% stake for the government. And it is efficient. Can Bangalore go this way?

item.title: Bangalore's electricity spend - how can we make it judicious?
item.dc:creator: News Desk
item.description: BESCOM Managing director Manivannan explains what is power, what causes power cuts and how everyone can contribute so that there is less power cut.

item.title: Children ideate to regenerate electricity
item.dc:creator: Reshma Arvind
item.description: The "Let’s Save a Billion Watts" campaign is educating children throughout India to save energy. Here's how members of civic clubs in various city schools are actively pursuing this initiative in their homes and outside.

item.title: In the offing: Plans to produce solar power in Bangalore homes
item.dc:creator: Sanjay Vijayaraghavan
item.description: Homes fitted with solar panels can sell excess energy to Bescom. Interested citizens and Bescom are discussing how to go about it.

item.title: Pollution watchdog to support apartments for better STPs
item.dc:creator: Navya P K
item.description: Residents are worried that builders are not ensuring that the STPs function well and comply to standards. KPSCB chairman Sadashivaiah promises to redefine STP norms and STPs certification by March.

item.title: Batti Bandh urges Bengaluru to ‘unplug’
item.dc:creator: Sneha Kar
item.description: A call to fight climate change on 13th February 2010, from 7 to 8 PM

item.title: Lighting lives
item.dc:creator: News Desk
item.description: Entrepreneurs rent solar powered CFL lights to small vendors, making it easier for the latter to ply their trade in the evenings too.

item.title: An uncomfortable summer coming up, stay informed
item.dc:creator: Supriya Khandekar
Vaishnavi Vittal
item.description: Rapidly coming off a cool winter, Bengaluru is back to the usual: hit by water and electricity shortages. Be it combating seasonal ailments or dealing with shortages, know what’s going on and what is to come.

item.title: Politicians want power, children need electricity for their future
item.dc:creator: N Mukund
item.description: Untimely power cuts in Bengaluru is causing a lot of distress to school children who have their exams.

item.title: BESCOM refunds for excess power cut
item.dc:creator: Supriya Khandekar
item.description: A citizen’s concerted efforts force BESCOM to compensate him. Other Bengaluru residents can take the cue and get refunds for long power cuts.

item.title: “Let there be light...”
item.dc:creator: Arun Patre
item.description: ...said the Maharajas of Mysore, and there was light! The story of how the city saw light in the early 20th century makes for fascinating reading.

item.title: Powerless in Jayanagar Complex
item.dc:creator: Supriya Khandekar
item.description: The mother of all shopping malls has been bearing the brunt of incessant power cuts and bureaucratic apathy for the past 33 years. Is anybody listening?

item.title: Refund for a power cut? Yes, it’s true
item.dc:creator: Supriya Khandekar
item.description: Did you know that BESCOM's power cuts are subject to scrutiny by the state's electricity regulator and the rules allow for penalties to be paid to consumers? Read on.

item.title: Power cuts temporarily on hold, says BESCOM
item.dc:creator: Supriya Khandekar
item.description: If the rains continue, there might not be any need for power cuts throughout the state, says H Nagesh, Director Technical, Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM).
